channel.title: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)
channel.description: Can someone tell me how to fix this?

item.title: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

I set my paths, look:

Name: CLASSPATH
Value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Name: PATH
Value: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic

yea your client cant find JDK, your computer doesnt know where to find it…setting paths will fix it

item.title: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

I have both Jdk and Jre 6.3, and i dont see editing my compiler as fixing my problem, because its my client that i need help with.

Read full topic
item.source: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)

item.title: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)
item.dc:creator: @BurnInSilence BurnInSilence
item.description:
@BurnInSilence wrote:

i can, download java at java.sun.com
add this to your paths
;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.###\bin
replace all the #s with your jdk version
note: JDK = Java Developing Kit
JRE = Java Runtime Environment
i recommend you download them both
option 2:
if you cant/dont know how to set paths then >.> add this directory to your compile/run instead of the javac *.java / java *.java
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk#.#.###\bin"
this calls the application you want
javac is the compiler
java is the runserver
post for more help

Read full topic

item.title: Javac cannot be recognized as an external or internal command (not compiler!)
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

this is asked at least 5 times a day now,just get a new compiler:

:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
title Perfect compiler 2.0
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit
[/code]

Read full topic
